title: How Secretary Blinken is tackling the China relationship (and others in the region)
description: Much of the Biden administration's approach to the world focuses on the U.S. competition with China.

title: A search is underway for Titanic touring submersible missing in the Atlantic Ocean
description: A submersible capable of taking tourists over 2 miles underwater to view the Titanic wreckage up close has gone missing.

title: "Profound differences" remain between U.S. and China, Secretary Blinken says
description: As U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken wraps up two days of diplomatic talks in Beijing, he said the two world powers must maintain communication despite "profound" differences.

title: "Profound differences" remain between U.S. and China, Secretary Blinken tells NPR
description: As U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken wraps up two days of diplomatic talks in Beijing, he said the two world powers must maintain communication despite "profound" differences.

title: Defense arguments to begin in youth climate trial in Montana
description: The only youth climate change lawsuit to make it all the way to trial is underway in Montana.

title: Antony Blinken meets China's Xi in a bid to ease soaring U.S.-China tensions
description: In footage released by China's state broadcaster, Xi is heard to say "The two sides have agreed to follow through on the common understandings President Biden and I have reached in Bali."

title: Huntington's spreads like 'fire in the brain.' Scientists say they've found the spark
description: Diseases like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's spread through the brain like a forest fire. A new study suggests how the fire starts.

title: A 3-hour phone call that brought her to tears: Impostor scams cost Americans billions
description: Imposter scams are top U.S. fraud now: Con artists are using new technology to get real time information plus voice cloning and caller ID spoofing to make it even harder to tell truth from fiction.

title: A new satellite could help clean up the air in America's most polluted neighborhoods
description: A new satellite will take continuous measurements of dangerous air pollution in the U.S. That has scientists, and residents, warily optimistic about undoing decades of environmental injustice.

title: For Democrats trying to retake Virginia legislature, fiery primaries are first hurdle
description: It's nearly been two years since Virginia Democrats lost the governor's office and the House to the GOP. Before attempting a comeback this fall, they must first survive Tuesday's expensive primaries.

title: Juneteenth, the newest federal holiday, is gaining awareness
description: Monday marks the Juneteenth holiday — a date commemorating the fall of slavery in the United States. While it's a new federal holiday, it's been celebrated since the 1860s.

title: Deadly West Bank firefight leaves at least 3 Palestinians dead, dozens more injured
description: The violence marked a rare use of Israeli airpower in the territory. During the clashes, Palestinian militants detonated a roadside bomb next to an Israeli military vehicle.

title: Multiple mass shootings across the U.S. leave at least 6 dead on holiday weekend
description: The shootings stretching from coast to coast follow a surge in homicides and other violence over the past several years that experts say accelerated during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Swiss voters support climate bill as scientists warn about melting glaciers
description: The referendum to introduce new climate measures was sparked by a campaign by scientists and environmentalists to save Switzerland's iconic glaciers, which are melting away at an alarming rate.

title: The FAA is investigating the latest close-call after Minneapolis runway incident
description: An American Airlines plane was ordered to cancel its landing after a Delta plane that had been cleared for take-off was still on the runway. The FAA is investigating how close the planes got.
